meanings.definition: Kabukis (noun): a traditional Japanese form of theater involving elaborate costumes and stylized drama.
meanings.sent1: The actors wore colorful kabukis during the performance.
meanings.sent2: The audience was mesmerized by the kabukis on stage.
meanings.sent3: The kabukis added a touch of elegance to the play.
meanings.sent4: Her emotions were like a kabukis, full of hidden meanings.
meanings.sent5: The beauty of the kabukis left a lasting impression on the viewers.

meanings.definition: Kabukis (verb): to perform in the style of kabuki theater.
meanings.sent1: She decided to kabukis for the school talent show.
meanings.sent2: The actors practiced hard to kabukis perfectly.
meanings.sent3: He always wanted to kabukis on a big stage.
meanings.sent4: Her dance moves kabukised gracefully across the floor.
meanings.sent5: The students were excited to kabukis in front of the whole school.
